data.chText: （电梯的）升降机井；通风井；竖井；井筒
data.enText: a long, narrow, usually vertical passage in a building or underground, used especially for a lift/elevator or as a way of allowing air in or out

data.chText: （箭、高尔夫球杆等的）杆；（锤等的）柄
data.enText: the long narrow part of an arrow, hammer , golf club , etc.
a metal bar that joins parts of a machine or an engine together, enabling power and movement to be passed from one part to another
either of the two poles at the front of a carriage or cart between which a horse is fastened in order to pull it
A shaft of moonlight fell on the lake.
a sudden strong feeling of pain, etc. that travels through your body

data.chText: 她听见身后有脚步声，感到一阵毛骨悚然。
data.enText: Shafts of fear ran through her as she heard footsteps behind her.
a clever remark that is intended to upset or annoy sb
to treat sb unfairly or cheat them

tr: the hollow spine of a feather
a revolving rod that transmits power or motion
a long rod or pole (especially the handle of an implement or the body of a weapon like a spear or arrow)
a long vertical passage sunk into the earth, as for a mine or tunnel
(architecture) upright consisting of the vertical part of a column
a vertical passageway through a building (as for an elevator)
a long pointed rod used as a tool or weapon
the main (mid) section of a long bone
an aggressive remark directed at a person like a missile and intended to have a telling effect
example: she takes a dig at me every chance she gets

tr: a line that forms the length of an arrow pointer
a column of light (as from a beacon)
defeat someone through trickery or deceit

value.def: A shaft is a long vertical passage, for example for a lift.

example.ex: He was found dead at the bottom of a lift shaft.
example.tran: 他被发现死在了电梯井的底部。

value.tran: (电梯等的)升降机井，竖井，井筒，通风井

value.def: In a machine, a shaft is a rod that turns round continually in order to transfer movement in the machine.
A shaft is a long thin piece of wood or metal that forms part of a spear, axe, golf club, or other object.
value.tran: (矛、高尔夫球棒等的)杆;(斧头等的)柄

value.def: A shaft of light is a beam of light, for example sunlight shining through an opening.

example.ex: A brilliant shaft of sunlight burst through the doorway.
example.tran: 一束耀眼的阳光从门口照射进来。
